snippet: The Obama administration is preparing to carry out a phased campaign requiring a sustained effort that could last until after President Obama has left office, according to officials.
abstract: Obama administration officials say that military campaign against Islamic State in Iraq and Syria could take three years to complete; second stage of effort, following current air campaign, will focus on training and equipping Iraqi military and Kurdish fighters; final stage, that of destroying ISIS army in its sanctuary inside Syria, may not be completed until after next administration takes office.

byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT, MICHAEL R. GORDON and HELENE COOPER
byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt and Michael R. Gordon reported from Washington, and Helene Cooper from Tbilisi, Georgia. Julie Hirschfeld Davis contributed reporting from Washington, and Azam Ahmed from Erbil, Iraq.

lead_paragraph: The Obama administration is preparing to carry out a phased campaign requiring a sustained effort that could last until after President Obama has left office, according to officials.

headline.main: Destroying ISIS May Take Years, U.S. Officials Say
headline.print_headline: Destroying ISIS May Take Years, U.S. Officials Say
